title: Switching $$x$$ and $$y$$
text: We must now substitute all instances for $$x$$ by $$y$$ and instances of $$y$$ by $$x$$. $$x=\frac{y+3}{y+7}$$
speech: We must now substitute all instances for  x  by  y  and instances of  y  by  x .  x is equal to fraction, y plus 3, over, y plus 7,
pacedSpeech: We must now substitute all instances for   x
.   x is equal to fraction, y plus 3, over, y plus 7,

title: Solving for $$y$$
text: Now, we must manipulate the equation and solve for $$y$$. $$x\left(y+7\right)=y+3$$. $$xy+7x=y+3$$. $$xy=y+3-7x$$. $$xy-y=3-7x$$. $$y(x-1)=3-7x$$. $$y=\frac{3-7x}{x-1}$$
speech: Now, we must manipulate the equation and solve for  y . , x, parentheses y plus 7,  is equal to y plus 3 .  x y, plus 7 x is equal to, y plus 3 .  x y is equal to y plus 3 minus, 7 x .  x y minus y is equal to 3 minus 7 x . , y, parentheses x minus 1,  is equal to, 3 minus 7 x .  y is equal to fraction, 3 minus 7 x, over, x minus 1,

.  , x,  y plus 7,  is equal to y plus 3
.   x y, plus 7 x is equal to, y plus 3
.   x y is equal to y plus 3 minus, 7 x
.   x y minus y is equal to 3 minus 7 x
.  , y,  x minus 1,  is equal to, 3 minus 7 x
.   y is equal to fraction, 3 minus 7 x, over, x minus 1,
